title: Why is this community so disgustingly generic ?

replies.body:
{{champion:33}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:154}} 

Just to name a few, are all also buffed. League is a diverse interesting game, don't be afraid of trying new stuff.
Mundo and Shen are still terrible junglers.

Different people play for different reasons.  And yes, a lot of people DO practice their ranked mechanics in normal games.  It's the whole point of practice!

As for the jungle, it's more diverse than ever, especially if you watch the LCS.  {{champion:79}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:254}} are *all* pretty popular in the jungle in competitive play right now and {{summoner:12}} {{summoner:11}} {{champion:102}} is making an appearance as an off-jungler in top lane.

Except Gragas, all the other junglers are nothing fresh tbh.

The off-jungler is new though.

This is a problem on any game that has a gigantic playerbase, with some requirement on memorisation or thinking. There are a lot of people who don't want to think when playing games, there is a reason why simpler games or dumb downs are mostly the ones dominating the market, with some exceptions.

Then besides that, there is Riot's balancing issues. Since we are no longer talking about competitively optimal and sub-optimal, it's almost always just competitively viable or unviable. So people are just like "wth would I want to purposely handicap myself so hard just for the sake of standing out a little?" (This Season seems to be hella better but still, it's Riot, you never know)

So if you wish to see a game community where people play their own style. you need to find a game that allows both dynamic customisable competitive playstyles, and has smaller enough active community so it doesn't get flooded by conformism.

People want to play what's good without taking the time and effort to calculate what's good, so they just do what really good players (who do take that time and effort) do.  This is the case in any game and is the entire purpose of having guides.

Yes that is obvious but everyone has their favorite champions and attachments to the game.

They don't need to play like clones most of the time, this "victory" screen isn't the reason why you joined the game.

At least it /shouldn't/ be.

You came here to have fun. Are you having fun being a replica? Are you having fun being one of the fukatrons of people who play Sej at the moment?

Did you even put time in playing Sej before she got popular ? Don't you feel like filth from the inside? ( hint: you should. )

Seriously, I'm not talking about ranked where it is understandable to use the most efficent strategy to win.

Blind pick & teambuilder become places to use the OP champions because they aren't banned.

Draft pick, similar reasoning: I am here to prepare for ranked and so I will practice muh sej mechanics.

What the actual fuk ?
